| Origin                  = A shared operation between [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]] and the [[Commission on Superhuman Activities (Earth-616)|Commission on Superhuman Activities]], the Redeemer program gives super-powered criminals a chance to regain their freedom by participating in a government controlled super-team.
| PlaceOfFormation        = Old [[X-Factor (Government) (Earth-616)|X-Factor]] Headquarters, [[Washington, D.C.]]
| PlaceOfDissolution      = Near [[Mount Charteris]], [[Colorado (State)|Colorado]]
| Creators                = 
| First                   = Thunderbolts #48
| Last                    = Thunderbolts #56

| HistoryText             = The Reedemers were first formed to ferret out a conspiracy within the [[Commission on Superhuman Activities (Earth-616)|Commission on Superhuman Activities]] in a joint operation between Valerie Cooper and the V-Battalion. They were created as a mirror of the original Thunderbolts:
*Citizen V – John Watkins III, the real grandson of the original Citizen V that Zemo pretended to be (possessed by Zemo at this time)
*Smuggler – Conrad Josten, [[Erik Josten (Earth-616)|Atlas]]'s younger brother, using Erik's second super-villain identity
*Beetle – Leila Davis, an old foe of [[Abner Jenkins (Earth-616)|Abner Jenkins]] in his super-villain identity
*Meteorite – Valerie Barnhardt, using [[Karla Sofen (Earth-616)|Moonstone]]'s heroic identity
*Scream – analog to [[Melissa Gold (Earth-616)|Screaming Mimi]] (and secretly her ex-boyfriend Angar the Screamer)
*Fixer – formerly Techno of the Thunderbolts, back in his original criminal identity and forced to work for the CSA

The Redeemers managed to learn that the conspiracy involved a mind-controlled [[Henry Gyrich (Earth-616)|Henry Peter Gyrich]]. When the Redeemers confronted Gyrich, he used nanites to control them and make them fight the [[Thunderbolts (Earth-616)|Thunderbolts]] team. After the Thunderbolts were disbanded and most members pardoned, [[Helen Takahama (Earth-616)|Jolt]] and [[Charles Burlingame (Earth-616)|Charcoal]] were added to the Redeemer program. The team trained, briefly, with [[Steven Rogers (Earth-616)|Captain America]].{{r|Thunderbolts #50}}

[[Franklin Hall (Earth-616)|Graviton]] returned to [[Earth]], looking to fight the Thunderbolts. Finding the Redeemers at [[Mount Charteris|Mt. Charteris]] instead, he attacked and massacred the entire team.  [[David Angar (Earth-616)|Scream]] vanished in a vacuum and Charcoal was ripped apart and spread across the desert as dust.  The gravitational forces keeping Jolt's bioelectric form together were removed, dispersing her body, while [[Valerie Barnhardt (Earth-616)|Meteorite]] was left floating in the upper atmosphere to suffocate.  The [[Leila Davis (Earth-616)|Beetle's]] armor was crushed into a tiny box and [[Conrad Josten (Earth-616)|Smuggler]] was apparently hurled into the Sun.  [[John Watkins III (Earth-616)|Citizen V]] and [[Paul Norbert Ebersol (Earth-616)|Fixer]] survived the assault, but the Redeemers were no more. Years later it was discovered that Smuggler had survived by teleporting into the darkforce dimension. Baron Zemo used Conrad's life as a bargaining chip to ensure Atlas would help him defeat Genis.{{Citation}}

| Notes                   = * [[Helen Takahama (Earth-616)|Jolt]] was able to pull herself back together, and rejoin the Thunderbolts.
